awd_abstract_narration: This award is for support of research to study the portion                      of the West Antarctic Ice Sheet which feeds in to the Ross                      Ice Shelf.  Radar soundings by both airborne and                                ground-based systems comprise the necessary elements of this                    research.  These activities are an essential part of the                        Siple Coast Project and the new WAIS initiative which have                      as goals: 1) Determination of the configuration and mass                        balance of the Siple Coast region of the West Antarctic ice                     sheet, 2) Determination of the physical controls of ice flow                    in this region, and 3) Prediction of the future behavior of                     this region using numerical models.  These models will be                       enhanced by an understanding of the relative motion between                     the surface and bed in the grounded region just upstream of                     the grounding line.

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
